snippet: Employees described a day-to-day management style in which she could shower workers with affirmation but then allow some to be laid off with only a phone call.

byline.contributor: Quentin Hardy and Kitty Bennett contributed reporting.

abstract: Republican presidential contender Carly Fiorina is recalled by insiders at Hewlett-Packard as contradictory figure during her six-year tenure as chief executive; struck positive and encouraging stance with her employees, but also oversaw layoffs of 30,000 employees in ways that appeared gratuitously impersonal.
lead_paragraph: Employees described a day-to-day management style in which she could shower workers with affirmation but then allow some to be laid off with only a phone call.

headline.print_headline: Fiorina’s Contradictory Time as the Chief of HP
headline.main: As a Boss, Carly Fiorina Was a Contradictory Figure at Hewlett-Packard
